text: Ok.  So imagine going to Vegas and you'll thinking this is going to be great.  Hit the Strip after a good meal, but not at this place.  Do not.  I repeat do not have the AYCE sushi, because it F'ing takes forever.  It took us an hour before we got our first order.  Thinking I was being smart, once I received my first order I decided to order my second set of sushi.  Apparently I wasn't that smart.  30 mins later still waiting.  Hey!  Mister Mgr saying sorry about the other negative reviews and promising that you will do better.  Keep your empty promises and hire better sushi chefs that actually handle AYCE sushi orders.

All you can eat is a great deal at $28 and the sushi was good. Alaskan roll, spring roll, and the cucumber salad were delicious, however the service was the slowest I've ever experienced. It took 15 min to be greeted, we had to ask for water repeatedly and none of our dishes were ever cleared, and the waiter was frequently absent when I wanted to order more our ask for water. Such a shame

I was so happy to found a sushi restaurant inside the hotel. I went there today and sit at sushi bar with my friend. The sushi chef is very nice at first. The food was so good. The service is great. Venny is our server. 

Here is what make me dissapointed. At the end of our meal when we are ready to leave, the shorter and light skin sushi chef ask me for tip. He said because he already gave me 2 free food but I didn't ask for it! I couldn't believe it!!! This is a J.W. Marriott Hotel and the employee asking me as a customer for a tip??!!! what a shame!! Isn't this hotel train their associates?
My friends told me too before about this situation, but I just not belive what they said. Now that I experience myself, I just wonder if he asked to all the customer at the bar for the tip.

I would like to give this restaurant a 5 stars but I cannot because the chef ruin the whole thing. Maybe next time I just sit at dining area and enjoy my dinner without somebody soliciting.
Poor choices during the buffet nights. Went recently on a Monday and was only one of a few diners seated in the restaurant. The server was friendly but difficult to get ahold of.
We had an excellent dinner, sat at the tappanyaki grill and food was fabulous as was our chef. Did not experience any bad service, food was fresh and served quickly.

The service and sushi happy hour were okay, but unfortunately the food at the habachi table was horrible. The dipping sauces were bland as well as the cooked items. Although the prices were slightly higher than other Japanese restaurants the quality of the food was much worse. No seasoned butter or oil was used and no care was used in chopping the vegetables for better taste or better presentation. We were very disappointed.

The service is just flawless... That's all I can say. My server that day was Venny. She suggested some choices for me and my kids which turned out to taste amazing. She vividly described the food and told us the daily special. We had some sushi which is pretty decent, but the steak that my son ordered was even better! Thanks again to Venny for recommending it.

Would most likely be 2 if we didn't have such nice servers.  And might have had more stars if there was some sort of atmosphere here.  The Disclaimer: We were staying at the hotel and didn't want to venture out.  This seemed to be a good option.

We had reservations at 8pm on a Friday night.  Earlier that day we had received a call to confirm our reservation because it "get's very busy, and they wanted to be sure we would be coming in".  When we arrive, we found that we were 1 of 2 couples in the entire place.  Wha??  It IS Friday night, right?  Where is everyone?  Apparently, at the Frankie Avalon concert that started at 7pm - we just missed the rush.  So....it is THAT kind of crowd here.  

While I was excited to have the teppanyaki table to ourselves, the prices were a little too rich for my tastes.  $48 for steak and shrimp meal seemed a little steep.  And I've seen that show too many times to get excited about it, so I didn't want to "pay" for the experience.  We moved to a regular table.

The other big thing here - None of their menus are correct.  They give you 3 when you sit down.  We ordered Gyoza ( listed on the menu available in chicken and shrimp) and we were asked if pork was ok. That was all they had.  While not actually listed on the menu, but on Opentable (and Yelp), they only serve Beer & Wine.  And my wine was listed at 2 different prices depending on what menu I read.  As we continued to find little errors like that our waitress just laughed and apologized.  She knew how ridiculous this was becoming.

Otherwise, the food was good and the service was good.  There was no vibe, no other people and no attention to detail on the menu.  And, there is outside seating - despite what you read.  However, I would likely not come back since there are definitely other places with a better atmosphere.

Tried Shizen for the first time tonight and all I have to say is Wow! We sat at the Sushi Bar and Chef Paul not only took care of us, but amazed us with his unique Sushi creations! Being avid Sushi buffs would highly recommend Shizen if your looking for great Sashimi, custom rolls & a chill atmosphere!

my husband and i celebrated our anniversary at the shizen japanese restaurant in the rampart hotel and casino.   it is owned and operated by the mariott hotel    here are the location details:


stylish jw marriott japanese restaurant offering teppanyaki tables & a sushi bar plus beer & wine.


located in: jw marriott las vegas resort & spa


address: jw marriott las vegas resort & spa, 221 n rampart blvd, las vegas, nv 89145


phone: (702) 869-7900

=======================================================

we were greeted by a young, but lovely and mannerly hostess.   she made sure we were seated within a minute.    our server, sean, was professional and hospitable.   our order was taken immediately and served promptly.    we ordered from the teppanyaki menu and had the filet mignon and lobster combo.    it comes with soup, salad, fried rice and the most delicious vegetables you have ever had.    we are not the biggest fans of vegetables, but these are cooked to perfection.

our teppanyaki chef was anthony.   omg, he was so pleasant and made conversation while entertaining us doing the cooking!    he asked if we were celebrating any special occasion and we told him it was our aniversary.   he arranged our fried rice into the shape of a heart.   we were impressed!    the food was absolutely delicious in every way.

we complimented the server, the cook and the hostess, but felt as though they all deserved to be recognized by management. so, we told the (female) manager that everyone had treated us like family.   she appreciated our comments and we are glad we took the time to tell her.   

the staff surprised us at the end of our meal by serving us desserts, compliments of the house.   a lovely gesture that will not be forgotten.

we do not eat sushi, so we cannot speak to the reviews we read about that.   however, i would hope that people would address their complaints/problems right then and there to receive immediate attention and resolution to their concerns.   

we can only speak for ourselves when we state that we were enormously happy with every aspect of our anniversary dinner.  

thank you, shizen, for a memorable evening!

helen & bob

Literally sitting in the restaurant right now writing this. I wish I could comment on the food,  but it's been 30 minutes and we barely got our water. No appetizers yet. They have 10 minutes before I walk out.

Had dinner here with the whole family. Sushi on happy hour was delicious and a huge bargain. We also had the edamame for appetizer. It was a little disappointing very bland could have used more sea salt. But the rest of the meal was scrumptious. We sat at a teppanyaki table, our steak and lobster was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The vegetable side was one of the best I've had in town.  

Service was excellent, cook was friendly and entertaining but not overdone.

This place is wonderful. My friend surprised me for my birthday and took me here for dinner. Our server Sean was very attentive. Nancy the manager was always walking around making sure everyone was happy. The food was great. I can't wait to come back. This is definitely a hidden gem of The Rampart.

My wife and i come all the time. I will say, years ago the service was slow. The past couple times i went the service was fine. If you are coming for a show from the chef, maybe check out behinanas but if you want the habachi style cooking the food is great. We always get the filet, lobster, shrimp and its always tasty. They have an aoli sauce which is really good. They sat us at 945 last night and they closed at 10. I think that is pretty accommodating. If you are local, i would go here.

This place was awesome, sushi was fresh and very tasty. Chef Paul, goes above and beyond to make sure your happy. The Las Vegas roll, Tiger roll, we're amazing!!!!!! Chef Paul also had a special made for us that is not in the menu and that was so so delicious!!!! 

I will definitely will be back during my 5 day stay at the JW Marriott.........

I went to Shizen tonight with my mom because she had a 100$ restaurant voucher.  I was curious about this place because my mom and I always went to the cafe when she got any of the free vouchers she gets from gambling at the Rampart. We got to Shizen about at around 5:54pm and had to wait until 6:00 for it to open. The menu was a bit high but with the voucher it was not much to worry about. 
What we ordered was:

*Spicy tuna roll (8 pieces)
*Spring roll appetizer (6 pieces)
*Teriyaki Chicken with veg/rice 
*Glazed Salmon with spinach/rice
*Green Tea Ice cream
*Mango Ice cream
 
Since it's Thursday the spicy tuna roll was half priced. I had the glazed salmon and my mom the Teriyaki Chicken. We both enjoyed what we had very much. Though I was full we both had desserts. I had the mango ice cream and my mom had the Green tea ice cream. I loved the mango ice cream. When I tasted my mom's green tea ice cream it had a bit of a strong "Tea" after taste.
Our total for everything was $72 and some change. Plus not forgetting a tip for our waiter who was alright. She kept checking up with us if everything was OK, and refilling our water glasses.

All in all I'd go again. When we went it was nice and quiet, no cigarette smoke in the air, and totally devoid of old people.

After coming here every once in a while, we were horribly disappointed in the poor service, due to lack of employees. Slow service, very long wait for anything, from sake to food. Tiny, skinny rolls were an embarassment. After waiting 40 minutes, we finally received something, the yakisoba was cold, the chicken was heavily overcooked to being so dry, it felt like cardboard. We sent the dish back, at the point the appetite is dead and you just want to pay and go. Never again, what has happened to the place?
We had dinner there tonight because we had a $25 off certificate.  I will not go back there unless the meal is free.   It's the worst sushi I have eaten in my life.
Awesome sushi and I was impressed being in Vegas and all. Excellent quality sushi. Sunday night all you can eat sushi for $28, can't beat that! I like it.
If I didn't stay in the hotel I would never eat there. Every time I send some kind of fish back. Would expect better from a JW Marriott. Not good at all and boring menu.

My experience was vey good, the service level was above average, I like smiles and friendliness and that is what I got. I sat at the sushi bar as I enjoy watching the prep also. Prices were very fair and saw happy hour pricing and that was very good. Manager Nancy waited on me and was extremely pleasant and nice. I was here for a convention, didnt want to drive and ended up here both nights I liked it so much. Also Japanese ateak house, but I was there for the sushi.

On business I decided to stop in for Sushi.  Other reviews had Shizen reared well, so I gave it a shot.  After a long day of travel, just wanted some spicy sushi and some rest!

I chose to sit outside.  It is a nice evening and the Brooke that runs next to the patio has a relaxing sound. As the evening has gone on, the lighting dims nicely. 

My waiter was Ramoel.  He was very prompt initially and offered his opinion on the special rolls of the day.  He was prompt with my edamame and drink order.  My rolls took an appropriate amount of time to follow.

I've had sushi all over the states and Vegas as well.  If have to rate the flavor and freshness as "ok."  The spicy tuna roll was decent. It didn't pack much spice which I would have preferred.  Especially since I'm from Texas, and we like the spice in our household!

I also ordered the Las Vegas Roll. It was also "ok."  I ate one piece and wasn't interested in more.  While it was ok, it wasn't fantastic.  I'm left craving sushi from some local places I like at home.  Tomorrow I'll try a different restaurant for dinner.  

3 stars for Ramoel and ambiance. The sushi I give a 2.
Both the food and service here are great! The tempura is light and non-greasy. The prime NY steak is so tender and yummy. We drive all the way from the Las Vegas strip just to eat here.

This was the most awful teppanyaki place I've ever been to!  Not only was it dead empty, which made for an awkward situation every time someone spoke, but the food was horrible!  

The salmon tasted very fishy and definitely not worth $32!  The portion of steak was tiny and dried out. Even the terriyaki sauce was bad...  How do you screw up terriyaki??  Fried rice had no taste either...

Will never return. I definitely recommend against this place!!

Excellent service and always delicious! My husband and I come on Sundays and Mondays for the "all you can eat sushi". Thein and Tao the Sushi Chefs make amazing rolls.  Always a fun experience, even though it is impossible not to over eat!

The happy hour special is decent, don't expect a lot of sushi options.  It didn't have tons of choices for rolls and such but it had a solid selection.  We sat at the sushi bar and the guys there were funny.  It was nice to have this as a selection at the Marriott because there isn't much outside the hotel close by. I would come back if I were at this hotel.

I was soooo disappointed in this place!! I actually work at a teppanyaki restaurant so I was excited to try a new location. We went last Tuesday the 21st. There were two other tables being cooked at the time we arrived. Our server was Ramo, and at first we weren't sure if he was new or not because he seemed so disconnected and aloof. We probably waited 20min before we were even brought waters, and it was another gentleman that brought it I believe his name was Shane. He on the other hand was on top of everything, wherever our server slacked he made up for it. We waited maybe close to an hour before our chef came out and James was delightful! Like I said working this type of restaurant I've basically seen the typical show, but James did some things I haven't seen before and made it enjoyable. The food I honestly wasn't crazy for, it lacked a lot of flavor and their sauces desperately need a makeover. I really feel like the menu is way over priced. And especially for the type of service that was provided. I even ask for another glass of wine and never received it. I doubt we will get return, but I do know anyone wanting to try it out I will recommend they request James he was the best part of that place! And Shane was awesome too!

Poor service tonight. I go here once a week. The short Hispanic lady that seats you doesn't necessarily seat you by first come. She has friends and takes tips to be seated before the folks waiting. 

I usually get all you can eat sushi on Monday evening. Tonight, 5 servers but service was slow. Never refilled drinking glasses. No noticeable adult manager.

I think it's time to find a new restaurant for me.

We have been frequenting Shizen for years now. At first the service was so bad that even with world class food I couldn't have given them more than 2 stars. But Marriot closed them down and revamped everything. 
The food is way better than it use to be. The sushi is fresh, The rolls very good. The seafood ramen bowl is excellent, the vegetable udon bowl needs more work. The Japanese Burrito roll, as strange as it sounds, needs a tasting. 
The wait staff is very accomadating and attentive. They remember everything and move with wings on their feet. Carmen the hostess was great greating us with a big smile and cheerful conversation every time we went. 
We'll miss this place as we are moving to Chicago.

This was my favorite restaurant in the JW Marriott resort area. I had the sushi with Shizen chicken and enjoyed both. The salmon in the Philadelphia roll was plentiful and the chicken was cooked and seasoned perfectly. 

It was not crowded at all while I was there, but shouldn't deter you from eating here if you are just looking for a good meal. Of the few restaurants to choose from at this resort, this is one of the better ones.
Love their happy hour!  Ask for Yenny for your server!  She is wonderful!  Excellent sushi and great service!  Love this place!!!

I have been her multiple times in the past couple of months and every time I enjoy it ! We used to go to a different Japanese restaurant and this place leaves me feeling better after eating overall . They don't use too much butter or oil and their veggies are great ! They also have SALMON ! Very pleased with this find !

Famous pros and cons to the point...no babbling chatter..

Pros:

Nice decor
Live cooking at tables as an option
Very good tasting food ( wife is Japanese and agrees)
Absolute top quality meat cuts!  I mean top. 
Worth the money
Very fresh top quality fish
Great variety of fish dishes
Nice location for West side
Not noisy or loud. Elegant atmosphere

Cons
Maybe a bit pricey but worth it for a special occasion and Japanese food lovers

Agree with the rest of these reviews, this place is terrible! Our server, Olivia, was never to be found throughout the meal. We had to wait more than 30 minutes just for them to cut sashimi. Everything else came out before the sashimi and when I went to ask the sushi bar, it was just sitting on the bar and of course Olivia disappeared. The rolls here are tasteless and have way too much rice. The manager was sweet but it was my birthday and all she could do was say sorry. Absolutely the worst.

All-u-can-eat sushi for $29. Good selection of appetizers, nigiri and rolls. No specialty rolls on AYCE menu. Promptly seated and served. Kevin made the sushi, very personable and good recommendations. Offered up a new fish to try that wasn't on the menu. Definitely recommend at the Marriott Resort.

This follow up is not having to do with my last review I left. I personally went there recently so my review stands as my own and boy it's a doozey! Went there when it was an all you can eat sushi night. It was quite busy and from the looks of things, sushi chef wise my assessment was right. Ordered some scallop roll along with some crab tempura roll variation. Get this.... (1 hour!!!!!) Wth hell were you guys doing??? Driving towards the bayarea to catch some scallops for the roll???!!! The crab roll I was gonna be lenient to but the scallop roll had no fancy prep work involved???!!! My folks may like this place but all three times I've been here, I think it's a dump and so's there food. Oh and btw.....turning the lights super dim in that one corner to hide all the mess and crumbs you fail to clean is not my idea of an upscale eatery.

We had to wait about 10 minuets for the hostess to even show up to seat us. The waiter was flat . As if he really did not want to be there. The orders of two people were placed on one plate, and ones person's order was brought to the table incomplete with no explanation or indication of when the rest will arrive. We had to ask another waiter for a little plate for soy sauce. The plate never arrived so I just got up and grabbed one from the bar. We had to flag the waiter to get refills. Food order spider roll, California, ah√≠ poki, octopus nigiri, salmon nigiri. Poki and octopus nigiri were ok, salmon nigiri and California roll were good, the spider was just bad.

Our server and hibatchi chef were great! Nice mix of veggies and 3 sauces - way better compared to other places. Flavor was great! Portion sizes are big and what you would expect - also, prices are what you would expect for a hibachi restaurant in a casino. Third restaurant to visit at the JW and overall service from hostess to water refill, to the check is a bit slow considering how slow the restaurants are this week. But I would definitely visit this place again - especially for hibachi.

this was AWESOME.  my husband and son had the best sushi ever, and i had steak and chicken.  the chicken had the yummiest toasted sesame seeds on it.  wow.

my son LOVED the yum yum sauce and everything else, including the eel.  he's 9 and more of an adventurer than his  mom.  he tried everything and loved it all.

the service was terrific.  not your usual unsmiling standoffish servers.  everyone here was friendly and nice.  

we liked it so much we went back the next night, after ordering, but not eating, the terrible food at Spiedini across the way.  

and we plan on going back later in the week.

my son would give it 10 stars out of 5.  it's a WOW for all of us.

Shizen Japanese Restaurant and the Rampart Casino is excellent. We had fantastic service from server Shane. We rate it a 10. Delicious food. I had the Mist Salmon and appetizers. .Shrimp Tempura..delicious.
The food was awesome the service was great the price was good I want to go back again and again if there was a grade higher then A+ Shizen deserves it I give then five starts.

I'm with my bros getting lit from Sapporo, this place FIRE FAM!! BEST SUSHI EVER
If you're on the west side of Vegas come here 
And get yo grub on :))

It's a 3.5 - 4.  I have to review this since no local has...  The food is ok to great depending on what you get with decent service.  It's prabably overall good.  It seems a little scary since it's not very crowded unless there's a conference or convention.  But over the 4 years I've been coming here, we've gotten better prices on the rest.com cert's so if you're going to go out to eat, you may as well get more for your dollar.  Their specialty is the butterfish.  This is a great place to have a spicy conversation or hold a mighty meeting since it's not noisy.  I would think you have to know about it to come here as it's in the JW Marriott & way southwest off the strip.

I was pleasantly surprised by this Japanese Sushi restaurant in the JW Marriott Rampart Hotel/Casino.

I really enjoyed the California tempura roll, volcano roll and nigiri sushi. Presentation was beautiful. Sushi was very fresh. Especially the uni with ikura. 

I went back many times during my stay and always had great service on top of the fresh sushi.

I read previous negative reviews, but I thought I would give them the benefit of the doubt and go with the positive reviews. I regret that decision.

The Cajun roll had nothing Cajun about it. The fish was disgusting. The only way I finished the roll was to remove the fish and dip the roll in soy sauce and saracha. The tempura also had a strange flavor and texture. The spicy salmon was below average.

Stay away from here if youre wanting sushi. The grilled food looked good butbi didnt taste it. I've had better sushi in New Mexico. The staff was good and the draft beer was perfect...the only two reasons for 2 stars.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. OK. The food is good. Once you finally get it. And you'd better not mind which course you get first. I got my main course long before our beverages or appetizers were served. My husband had nothing. We sent my main course back, then still had a long wait before we got our beverages and my salad. My husband still had no appetizer. His appetizer (a very complex Miso soup, duh) arrived at the same time that my entree made its second appearance. Don't waste your money here. There are a lot of much better sushi places in town.

I tried this place while staying at the Marriott Resort and Casino. I went in about 35 minutes before closing time and they sort of ignored me until I approached someone to seat me. I subsequently felt a bit rushed. They were clearly not thrilled with late diners coming in.

I found the sushi to be adequate but certainly not special. Everything was also priced substantially above what you would find in the area, which wasn't surprising considering a hotel restaurant. The disappointment related to the the completely mundane food and small portions (basically a poor value). 

I would not return. If seeking sushi, I would explore the local options away from the hotel. 

On the positive side, my server was friendly and accommodating.
We hard to wait almost an hour to get our food. Our rolls were poorly made and super small. I was floored when our bill was $82. I would never go back

Came here 2 months ago, Valentine's Day, this place was fine. Last night, their Happy hour sushi was bottom of the "barrel" sushi, maybe because it was Thursday and they were getting rid of the Bottom fish sushi for the Easter Weekend. Atleast they took it off our bill of $20.00 since we ate a bite or two and ugh spit it out. The Happy hour Calif Roll was so mediocre, we joked it might have been gas station sushi. Very disappointed. Yeah, I'm staying away from here during Happy Hour.

One of the coolest Japanese restaurants in town. So many options. You can dine at the sushi bar, in the dining room, have the full grille show with the chef (totally awesome!!!) or dine on the beautiful outdoor patio!!! The food here is excellent!!!  Service was great, recommend dining early to avoid the crowds that show up during traditional meal times.  Also recommend the full grille show for a totally unique experience!!! And fun!!! Have your camera ready!!!

just a week ago shizen reopened after being closed for a couple of weeks. the previous owners are no longer in the picture and shizen is now owned by J.W. Marriott.

there was rumor that the current exec. chef is a gentleman from the show top chef. i am not certain if this is true and forgot to ask while i was dinning last night.

in my previous review, i gave the restaurant 4 stars. i now give it 4.75. haha it's got more atmosphere, the servers are nicer and more attentive, (maybe because it's a J.W. restaurant now?!?!) they have great tea, the menu is half sushi and half entree, and all in all has a better vibe and energy. =)

we ordered:

agadashi tofu
dynamite roll
california crunch roll
ahi poki
marinated scallops
edemame
spicy miso soup (crab and wakame) you can ask for shitaki too! =)
tea and diet coke

total : $88.00 

it was just the right amount of food and i don't mind paying what we did for the quality and freshness. 

mahalo, shizen!
IG#ShizenLV James made the night. Nothing like catching tossed food at your Teppanyaki table after your daughter's dare the chef.

I've eaten at this restaurant during my stay. I had The Monkey Brain Sushi and the chicken ramen noodle as my main course. The sushi was very good. The noodles and the chicken tasted very goo. The Service was excellent! Very nice server. I would recommend this place if you are staying at the Marriott Resort in Las Vegas and looking for Japanese meal.

They really need to work on the level of service here because it's pretty awful.

My wife and I did teppanyaki dining here the other night.  We had a reservation and arrived right on time.  We were seated and I noticed from the reservation sheet that they had other groups of people at the table -- perhaps one too many because when we were seated the hostess said "Oh, I'll probably end up pulling another chair over here to fit them in."  Why should we feel cramped at a table because someone either made a mistake or overbooked when taking reservations?  In any case, one party didn't show up, so we didn't ever run into issues.

After we were seated it was only a minute or so before drink orders were taken.  Our drinks arrived a couple of minutes later and we made our orders.  Fully 20 minutes elapsed between when the waiter dropped our drinks off before he came by again to drop off miso/salads, and even then we had to ask him as he was walking away to refill our very empty glasses.  

Eventually, 35 minutes we were seated the chef showed up along with our yakitori chicken skewer appetizer.  40 minutes after being seated my ramen finally showed up.  40 minutes!  

In any case, the chef was good, although the food left a bit to be desired for the price.  The yakitori was overcooked & dry, the ramen was a bit too close to packaged noodles you get at the store (although the broth & chicken were nice), the rice was a bit bland, and the filet would have been much better with a traditional steakhouse preparation.  The bright spot in the meal was the teppanyaki chicken.  In all, we spent nearly 3x as much time waiting for food as we did actually eating.

If the meal hadn't been comped & we didn't have time to kill before meeting up with someone, we probably would have left without getting anything other than our first round of drinks.

We stay at the JW Marriott whenever we travel to Las Vegas.  The facilities, superb service and proximity to family make it a perfect destination. We tried Shizen for the 1st time June 6th and had mixed results. The potstickers and sushi were first rate. The $25 teriyaki was beyond bad. The chicken tasted like rubber, worse even than what you'd expect from frozen cutlets. The ice tea was made from concentrate, and tasted awful. To the restaurants credit we weren't charged for the teriyaki after we brought the lack of quality to their attention.  My advice is to order the sushi only if you dine at Shizen.

I read the reviews on this place just before I left.  I asked the question when I arrived, "Have you been here before?"  "A while back, it was pretty good." 

We had reservations for 7:30pm on a Friday night.  A good call I thought.  A table of 5, we all arrived on time.  

Service was pretty slow to start.  There were only 2 other tables although there were two small parties around the hibachi.   Additionally a few people at the sushi bar, but very quiet.  Reservations definitely NOT required.........

Finally our drinks arrived, and we all ordered a couple of sushi dishes each, with some edamame to start.  

After nearly an hour (I'm not kidding) I walked over to find that some of our food was waiting on the side to be delivered to our table.  Of the 5 plates, 3, then 4 were ready, but were just sitting there....... drying up.

We asked why our food was taking so long, and a guy, (I hope he's not a waiter!) abruptly turned to us and said, "We're VERY busy!"  There was only ONE other table (still waiting for food) in the WHOLE restaurant.  

It took over an hour before all of our food arrived.  

The rolls were small, though tasty.  The food didn't taste terribly bad, but it had lost a lot of that "fresh, just made" taste that separates this sushi to supermarket sushi.

One sushi chef for this type of restaurant for a Friday night?  That's crazy.

Maybe because few people come here to eat, they don't need many staff, or they don't need many staff so one comes here to eat?  Either way, it was a dismal meal, with appalling overall service, and surprisingly this restaurant sits inside a JW Marriott Resort??  I wonder if they know how bad this is?

The manager did come over an finally apologize to us.  We were offered a free beer (for those drinking beer) or 15% off.  She did a good job listening, but I feel this isn't the first time she's heard these complaints, and looking at the other reviews, I'm sure it's not.

One thing's for sure, they make TV shows about failing restaurants like this.  Gordon Ramsey, where are you?

Would I recommend this restaurant for sushi?  "Methinks not."

I met some friends at the JW Marriott for teppanyaki dinner.  I have seen Shizen there but I had never been to the restaurant.  

After a server took drink orders our chef arrived and started to make the fried rice on the grill.  He did some of the fun stuff such as the flaming onion tower and he did a routine with the fork and knife but there wasn't a whole lot of showy cooking.  He was an affable guy.

The food was well prepared with ample portions.  With the teppanyaki, you also get miso soup and a salad.

Prices are comparable to other teppanyaki places.
Great food fabulous atmosphere. What a great way to spend a Friday night. The steak is superb. Will be back.

I had high hopes for this place, I've been passed it over the years and I was sure it might be a nice place to go to.

So we roll in without a reservation, lucky we didn't reserve it was far from busy on a Friday night.

We we're waiting not that long to be seated. My first impression of this business was not of a normal sushi place, actually I kinda thought the decor was a little cheap. Not the standard a marriott would present.

We grab a few rolls, nothing really special on the menu that stood out that I could really say would have me back again.

Had some green tea ice cream which wasn't to bad, had a little sugar on the side which was a nice touch.

All in all it was just average. Not a place id go back to because I can get the Same experience or better somewhere else

Stayed at the JW Marriott and didn't feel like driving anywhere. Shizen is located at the Rampart Casino and is actually owned & operated by the JW Marriott.

For being a Monday the dining room was quite full - possibly due to the heavy rain  incurred. I was receiving flash flood warnings every couple of minutes on my cell phone. My waitress from Hawaii was incredibly friendly and gave some solid recommendations of sushi and rolls to order. Service and turnaround on my orders were quick considering how busy they were.

The seaweed salad,calamari salad, poki, fried tofu and shishito peppers were solid starters. We then enjoyed tuna, eel, salmon, scallop, uni and clam sushi. Last round included baked mussels, spicy tuna roll,  crunch roll, and Las Vegas roll. I ended my Japanese feast with a yummy hot bowl of miso soup. 

Only con here was I had no room for dessert! Overall, I was satisfied with the service and Quality not to mention the convenience of dining a short walk from my hotel room.

BTW, Sunday and Monday is AYCE sushi and is only $28.00 a head.

This is the second time I've been here and I had such a blast with my girlfriends! James was our cook and he did an amazing job as usual he's funny he keeps the crowd going,  makes us laugh,  and all and all cooks great food. I highly recommend coming here with a couple friends have some drinks and some laughs and a good time.
We tried the restaurant for the first time and it will be our last.  The service was slow and poor and the food was not good.  A one hour meal became a two hour meal for sushi.
I like eating here every time I'm in Vegas because of the friendly service, nice ambiance and almost everything is WIlD!!  The food is tasty and always fresh, just the way I like it.   Happy eating!!

Chef Thein makes the most beautiful, artistic & delectable creations that make you want more. Best sushi I've EVER had! Excellent service experience from the time we walked in to the time we parted. Highly recommend Shizen if you are seeking a 5 star dining experience.

Tried this place with a restaurant.com certificate. It was dead empty on weekend night (that should have been a clue).  They no longer offer all the things on the menu shown at restaurant.com.  Don't seem to have as many bento box selections as previously shown.  They now seem to be either teppanyaki or kind of a japanese "tapas". Tried the "tapas" and regretted it. While the food wasn't bad it wasn't good.  The portions were small and overpriced. Service was good but they didn't have anyone else to wait on.

First time last night and it was FABULOUS.  Food GREAT. Service FANTASTIC.  The entire staff was friendly.  Came by our table to make sure every thing was fine.  My wife and I go out once, twice a week and this was sincerely one of the nicer overall dining experiences in a long time.   Can't wait to go back!

Food was decent. Chef was terrible. 

If you've had teppanyaki before or seen it, you know paying $30-$40 is for the food and the experience from the chef. Our table welcomed a chef with tattoos and a white chef hat. This was by far the longest, most awkward, boring teppanyaki experience I've ever had. He had ZERO interaction with us. Only time he spoke was "hello" and "how would you like your steak done?". He had 1 trick (onion volcano, which he completely botched and continued cooking). No wait 2, banging his spatula on the table while sprinkling salt. 

Upon exiting, we were approached by the manager who asked how was our dinner. We said it was alright and kept walking. She stopped us and apologized, asked if anything was wrong with the food. I told her no, but I've never been more bored in my life. We asked if the chef was training and new due to his lack of presentation and she replied, well he's new at doing the teppanyaki, but he is the head chef. And no, he doesn't do any tricks. I said well then what was the point of us paying for that? You might as well have sat us at a regular table, cooked in the kitchen, and we would have had the same experience/outcome. 

The family at our table also said they wouldn't be coming back and gave us 2-3 other teppanyaki places they frequently visit that are 10x more fun (Benihana, Hokkaido, and Musashi)
Great atmosphere, mediocre service and food was just ok. Pricing not worth the time and food quality.
Food was ok but it took so long to get our food we canceled half of it & went some where else

I wish I could leave a better review for this place but our experience was so terrible I don't know if I could even attempt a second chance.

My mother-in-law made reservations on a Sunday night for 5 of us. We originally wanted to do Tepoanyaki - not available. Oh well - sushi it is. My husband and I both ordered AYCE, while others ordered one roll or an entree. First off the waiter notifies us, "we're out of crab completely" - what. 95% of sushi rolls contain crab so what do we do? They replaced everything that would contain crab with shrimp. Including California rolls, not my personal favorite but they did improvise, I guess. 

The shrimp however was our smallest issue - no pun intended. The service was by far, the worst I've experienced since I've moved to Las Vegas. We were in the restaurant a total of 2 hours and my husband received 2 rolls, I received 1 (remember AYCE), my mother-in-law NEVER received her entree and another guest who was with us received 1 out of the 2 rolls she ordered. During a 2 hour span! We asked the waiter over and over and finally realized it wasn't happening.. There were 4 tables in the restaurant, there's no way they were that busy. No refills during the entire visit and in the end when we asked for the manager, though apologetic she only offered to comp the food my mother in law never received. What? 

We paid almost $200 for 2 "all you can eat" meals that didn't even fill us up because we didn't receive over half of the rolls we ordered..and other miscellaneous rolls that never even appeared. We grabbed dinner before seeing A comedy show that night and had to stop at Wendy's so that we all weren't starving. Not impressed.

Nice sake selection, with three different sizes to choose from. 

The sushi itself is fine, really nothing too exceptional in terms of quality or variety. They were out of the Toro, but they had maguro. The Ikura was very flavorful, actually, not too salty. The dragon roll was fine, again, nothing outrageously exciting but certainly pleasant and tasty. The spicy baked mussels are indeed spicy, and a nice change of pace. 

You might miss the entrance, as it's set back in the hallway. But, for a lighter meal, Shizen is a good option.

I do not recommend this place at all!

The service was terrible. Dirty dishes left on the table, never refilled the tea cups, it took too long to deliver the food to the table, they serve sushi without wasabi and ginger, and they were out of eel.

I started out with the seaweed salad. It was good. Then came the cold agedashi tofu, need I say more. My entree was the Luke warm seafood ramen. I am very disappointed with this place.

The other person with me had freezer burnt dried out sushi. What a waste of money.

Horrible!!!! The service was slow, the portions were small. We sat at the sushi bar for 20 minutes waiting for our sushi. A couple just got their and they get their Wasabi and ginger inmediately. I complained and finally we get our Wasabi and ginger. Followed by our sushi which was bad. you can tell they didn't wash the seafood properly. They fried the tempura items in old oil; the taste of it was evident. I'll never go back.

It is a beautiful, but largely unoccupied Japanese restaurant.  We started with potato croquettes (3 *) and soft shell crab (0*).  The crab was unrecognizable, overcooked, tasteless and overpriced.  We each ordered the misoyaki butterfish, black cod (4* Forks) which was accompanied by miso soup (1*), salad (dressing congealed - 1*), rice and green tea.  Service was both pleasant and efficient.

I waited to be seated as the sign directed, but I waited far too long and was never acknowledged.  I had to flag someone down.  Once seated at the counter, no one came to offer me a drink and the three chefs ignored me.  A young man sat down two seats to my right and was immediately given water and tea and asked if he was ready to order.  He was not and I waited and waited and had to let someone know I was ready to order.  I had the ahi poki and seaweed salad which were both drenched in soy sauce.  I would have preferred to pour the amount of soy sauce I wanted myself.  It made it appear they were trying to hide the color of the tuna, just saying.  Although the food was passing good, the only memory I came away with was the rude and unwelcoming behavior of the staff.

What a nightmare. I thought I must be on some kind of tv show this place was such a disaster. The hostess was clueless. The restaurant was half empty but no one could be seated.  We had a 7:30 reservation, were seated at 7:50pm and literally told it would be "a while" before anyone could serve us. 

We did the all you can eat dinner and again, what a joke. The "cucumber salad" was - and I am not exaggerating! - 6 tiny half moon slices of cucumber. The wait was unreal for our food.  At one point, it had been an hour since requesting a spicy tuna roll - I had to go up and ask them to prepare it myself. 

Every other word was "sorry". And not just for us - everyone seemed miserable and hungry and angry. 

It got to a point where we were so fed up we just left a little money on the table and left. I've never seen a place so disorganized, slow, sloppy, and frankly, not even caring that they are a disaster.

The JW Marriott is such an amazing property. I can't believe they allow a place like this to tarnish that.

Great food excellent service no need to go to the strip patio dining need I say more great menu excellent sushi in the JW Marriott easy parking excellent grounds at the JW Marriott fun to walk around after a large dinner meets the standard of other cities like San Francisco and have large Japanese population restaurant

Enjoyed a pleasant dinner with family here during a business trip to Vegas.  Inside a casino off the strip, so it's a little more laid back and prices seemed more reasonable.  Wouldn't know though since we splurged and order a ton of dishes off a $360 comp.  Us 4 adults, 2 toddlers, enjoyed a humongous meal of some delicious appetizers, steak kebabs, sushi, warm sake, brewskies, and more.  

Dined like royalty.  Good food, good company, good times.

Thanks Shizen!  Enjoyed it

Great food and standard Teppan "show". However this place gets dinged for its terrible service. We had a large party and 8 o'clock reservations, but didn't get seated until about 8:30. One table was entirely kids and the other adults. They took the kids order then let them sit for a long time while they waited for room to sit the adults. Once we were seated they took drink orders and then took over 20 minutes to bring them out. Then another 10-15 before taking our dinner order.

There were only about two other tables and they eventually left so there was no reason for the service to be so slow.

Once the "show" started, after one of the adults went looking for our waiter and told them to start cooking for the kids who at this point were ready for bed, things went well. Your typical Benihana production complete with flaming onion volcano. But no shrimp tail into shirt pocket.

Food was really good. But service was close to unbearable. We were at the restaurant before 8 and left after 10:30.

I would give it 2.5 stars but I will give them the benefit of the doubt on service. Maybe someone wasn't there and they were short staffed? If you go, just be prepared to spend some time,
Not even close to good. I had a Samin sushi and I threw up in my mouth. Good not stand it at all. The ramen was salty and the noodles was hard. The service was average.
Bluh! Had yakisoba..too much sauce & it tasted like Japanese BBQ. Sake was good, shrimp cooked well, but no, will not go back!

One of our favorite places.  Paul is a great personable sushi chef, and Tao is the best teppan chef we have ever had.  Nancy, the manager, is very  professional, welcoming, and accommodating. The food is excellent!!

This place doesn't deserve even one star. The WORST sushi I have ever had. Very pricey and flat out disgusting. Do not go here, there are so many local places ( Sushi Fever) that have amazing sushi and you will never get sick. My stomach was hurting before we even left the building. Anybody giving this more than one star has obviously never had sushi before.

This is the second time we have been here and we will be back again. The food is great and the waitress was wonderful.
The one thing I would do is change the music. We sat outside tonight. It was a beautiful night and setting.
But this is a Japanese restaurant! The rap music and whatever they were plaing definitely did not fit in.
Please, please play some Japanese music!!
Thank you

Checked into the hotel, and made the trek from the spa tower where my room was through the casino to the promenade specifically to get sushi. Got to the restaurant at 945 and asked if I could get some quick sushi (they close at 10 PM). The hostess said 'certainly' and seated me at the sushi bar with menus. There were two guys eating to the left and two girls eating to my right. I had time to read the board, the menu, make decisions on food and drink. I'm going to splurge and have some Toro, some sweet shrimp, and probably a roll. The sushi chef had put wasabi and ginger in front of me, but then neither of them would make any eye contact with me to ask if I was ready to order. So I think they're waiting for a server to take my order. Ok. But there is no server. And now there's no hostess, I sit there empty-handed with not as much as a glass of water and I'm tired, and hungry, and getting extremely irritated that I'm being actively ignored. 

The sushi chef asked the two gentlemen how their sushi is. Still no eye contact with me.  Finally a server appears, checks on the girls beside me, and refills their hot tea, and actually looks at me and then walks away. Seriously. At this point I've been seated over 10 minutes, I had put my menus aside, and cannot get acknowledgment to get a drink or order food. Am I supposed to tackle someone? I get up from my seat and walk towards the door, still unacknowledged. 

Maybe I was wearing my invisible suit? I don't know if anyone in that restaurant even realized I left. The sushi looked good.  I guess I'll never know. I certainly don't feel inclined to give them another try if no one in there is responsible for the customer experience. 

My first night in the Marriott resort, dinner consisted of a package of almonds from the airport. Yaaay. Going to be a long week at this rate.

Not a lot of selections when it comes to sushi but their teppanyaki  is great! Our chef was very engaging and funny. The food was perfectly cook as well. The chicken macadamia with fried brown rice is one of my favorites. If you are looking strictly for sushi, this is not the place for you but their noodles, appetizers and entr√©es are pretty good! I would definitely go back!

JW Marriott is 13 miles off the strip. Don't come here if you are on the Strip and want Japanese food. It's good but not THAT good.

The wait for our sushi was at least 1 hour. The rolls came out so sporadically and we all were like vultures when food came to the table. The food was good- nothing spectacular. Service gave us extra rolls for waiting and being patient. This place gets crowded because of conferences but I don't think so for any other time. Overall, I left kind of hungry. Service was really nice though.

Solid 3 stars.

Gr8 sushi and teppan table cooking in a beautiful restaurant w/gracious servers.  Appetizers are delicious.  Kind of pricey but lots of coupons available for locals.  I like the rolls, tofu, filet, seaweed salad and vegetarian teppan.

In regards to my review of feeling "overcharged" for a specialty item on Tuesday evening.  It turns out it was just a simple mistake. And we all make mistakes! 
Kudos to the fabulous JW Marriott, Shizen and their teams for catching the mistake, contacting me and remedying the situation. 
They are so on the ball and ALL about the customer. Service at it's finest!!
Great Christmas Eve dinner! Fresh and amazing flavors. Everyone is friendly.  We always request Sean. His professionalism and service is impeccable.

My friend had a free pass for dinner so we decided on sushi and to check out Shizen inside the Rampart Casino.

It took forever to get the hostess to seat us, she would take a group back and then disappear for like 10 minutes. When it was finally our turn, we asked to sit at the counter and she just said go ahead. Then another 5 minutes passed before getting a menu. Locating a server took another 10 minutes. Very poor and slow service by the front.

Our waitress on the other hand was very quick and efficient. We placed our drink and food orders at the same time (since we had plenty to look at the menu). 

The food: We ordered happy hour rolls of crunchy crab, spicy tuna, and sashimi orders of the blue fin tuna special and garlic salmon. My friend went with a Rampart roll and I went with a Philadelphia roll. The blue fin tuna was good, the salmon had a funny taste, and we both noticed very hard rice on different items. 

Needless to say, we both were not impressed and gave this place a big thumbs down.

service is too slow. Waitress kept disappearing. I had to wait an additional 23 minutes after my wifes sushi came out. When i asked what was taking so long, the waitress said my dish was being made fresh. FRESH? Are not all sushi rolls made fresh i asked? The special tuna in a cucumber (no rice) was ruined by too much onion. They have an all you can eat on Sundays. If it is on a time limit, DO NOT GO. They take too long to make your sushi.
What an overall disappointing experience.  We sat and waited forever for the teppanyaki experience to begin.  It was mediocre at best.  We won't be back.  The food quality is not very good.

Tried to grab dinner on a week night while staying at the JW earlier in the evening. No one was waiting in line. Only 2 people at the sushi bar (probably seats at least 15). 

Hostess told me that it was a 15-20 minute wait for 2 people. Asked if we could sit at the sushi bar. She said it would still be a 15-20 min wait because she was trying to allow "her servers to catch up". 

Never had that experience before at a nicer restaurant. Appreciate the honesty, but getting sat down with a drink and knowing that we would be waiting for food would have been much better than being told we couldn't be seated for 15-20 minutes despite so many empty seats.
